SUMMARY: YgiV had been predicted as a transcriptional regulator [9278503, 19376874]. However, based on nickel enrichment DNA microarrays and additional gel shift assays, it was identified as a transcriptional repressor of mcbR, which regulates biofilm formation and mucoidity by repressing expression of mcbA (ybiM) [18309357]. MqsR has a toxic effect on Escherichia coli bacterial growth, which is partially reduced by ygiV mutation [18309357].
